metadata.Name: ArabicDialectIDCorpus
metadata.Description: A dataset for dialect identification in Arabic broadcast speech, containing five dialects: Egyptian, Gulf, Levantine, North African, and Modern Standard Arabic.
Provider: MIT Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory
JHU Center for Language and Speech Processing
metadata.Paper Title: Automatic Dialect Detection in Arabic Broadcast Speech
Affiliations: Qatar Computing Research Institute, HBKU, Doha, Qatar
MIT Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory (CSAIL), Cambridge, MA, USA
JHU Center for Language and Speech Processing (CLSP), Baltimore, MD, USA
École de technologie supérieure, Département de Génie Logiciel et des TI, Montréal, Canada
Centre for Speech Technology Research, University of Edinburgh, UK
metadata.Abstract: This paper investigates different approaches for dialect identification in Arabic broadcast speech. We explore phonetic and lexical features obtained from a speech recognition system, and bottleneck features using the i-vector framework. We validate our results on an Arabic/English language identification task and a binary classifier to discriminate between Modern Standard Arabic (MSA) and Dialectal Arabic. We also report results for the five most widely used dialects of Arabic: Egyptian, Gulf, Levantine, North African, and MSA.
